intro: Cephalotomandra fragrans, commonly known as the fragrant bellflower, is a perennial herb native to Australia. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, fragrant flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features linear, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and are borne on slender stems. Cephalotomandra fragrans is often found in open woodlands and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained conditions.
